runs.comm: back of a length, hint of shape into Shehzad, played into the leg side
has to dive to make his ground! Tucked the ball into midwicket, very close to Hales who misses with his throw...probably would have been out
ducks in nicely from a fullish length and takes the pad then escapes down to third man
shapes down the leg side, Buttler's turn to appeal for a catch this time and then see the umpire's arms outstretched...Willey wasn't interested
charges down the pitch and tries to club a lengthy delivery wide of mid-on but can't get it wide of a diving Plunkett

has Willey pulled off something brilliant here? Direct hit from his follow through. He's safe! Superb effort, though, as he sprinted from his delivery, gathered the ball which had ended up close to the batsman, swivelled and then hit the non-striker's stumps direct
some sharp, late movement for Willey...similar to the previous ball which jagged back in and took an inside edge, not far from the stumps
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
nice delivery, a touch shorter outside off, shapes away off the seam and a little in the air as Shehzad drops his hands
this one is speared down the leg side
fuller, at the stumps, worked out to deep square
another one angled down the leg side, another appeal for a catch by Buttler and another wide called
back outside off on a full length, driven firmly to square cover
this is a little poor from Woakes as he pushes another one way down the leg side...third wide of the over
short outside off and convincingly fetched with a pull which goes straight of mid-on
fuller at off stump, driven to the covers...a lengthy over ends
that's sweetly put away over deep square leg, full on the pads by Willey and it's powerful flicked away with plenty of bottom hand
a touch straighter, still on the pads, a well-timed clip but straight to midwicket
a length delivery, heading leg side, swung away through square leg
gets more onto off stump, driven firmly to the covers
clears mid-off this time, clears his front leg and drills through the line of a full delivery outside off
super over for Pakistan as Willey stays onto the pads and Shehzad pulls it away wide of short fine leg
starts with a short one, at 87mph, and gets hooked over short fine-leg...not entirely in control, but effective
another short one, a bouncer over middle and leg, and given as a no-ball for height
that is swung miles into the night sky, heaving across the line of a length delivery, it's caught at deep square but it was in the air for so long it was an easy two
fuller, angled into the pads, worked to the leg side
that's huge! Shehzad is on fire. An effortless pick-up of a back-of-a-length cross-seamer outside off and deposits it into the stands at deep midwicket
worked off the pads out to deep square
that's a better ball to finish with, full on middle, blocked back to the bowler
round the wicket, uses his feet then pushes to cover
more good footwork as he skips down the pitch then flicks through midwicket
opens the face and drives to point
dropped a little short, he latches on with a strong pull which has just enough on it to beat deep midwicket as he runs around

uses his feet, held back by Parry, cut towards point and nearly carries then they end up getting a single anyway because of a throw which Parry palms (or parries?) away...careless from England, who are a little rattled
lovely bowling! Terrific flight, dropped the length a bit shorter, then it turned beautifully past the outside edge of the advancing Shehzad which gives Buttler a comfortable stumping
massive appeal for caught behind as he has an ugly swing across the line...Buttler was convinced this time. Couldn't hear a nick
dragged down a little short, clobbered through midwicket, it holds up in the outfield and there's nearly a run out as Hafeez sends Rafatullah back as he wanted a third!
short of a length outside off, cut down to third man
full, driven firmly straight down the pitch and Woakes does well in his follow through
back of a length, hitting the pitch hard, played to backward point...can't say the calling between this pair is very certain
well bowled, full outside off, he comes forward and pushes square into the covers
wide outside off, can only chop to backward point
full on the stumps, driven square this time
this one spins quite sharply, Rafatullah waits for it but can only pick out short third man
a well-controlled sweep from outside off to deep square
googly outside off, backward point again in the action to make sure it's another dot ball
touch shorter outside off, driven to deep cover but just two runs off the over
flicked off the back foot along the ground through midwicket
looped up very slow at 43mph, full and driven to deep cover
dragged down short, Hafeez on the back foot and pulls firmly but straight to deep midwicket with one bounce
goes for the reverse sweep but can't beat backward point
drives out to deep cover
nicely bowled, this one a touch quicker at 55mph, he uses his feet but can only push it back to the bowler
another stumping! The pressure tells. He comes out of his crease and then drives over the top of a full delivery. Neat take and swift work from Buttler
goes back to a shortish delivery, it spins and he places it out to deep cover
full and straight, defended back to the bowler
swipes across the line of a full delivery and finds deep square
picks out cover as he drives, excellent pressure from England's spinners
slides off the face to backward point...the squeeze is on
that will help! Makes clean connection on this short delivery from Parry and manages to clear deep midwicket with a crisp pull
short outside off but steered to point
well bowled, touch quicker and it spins to beat the outside edge
that's a filthy full toss but it has been clothed and isn't far from carrying to deep midwicket
punched with a straight bat through midwicket
that's very classy from Hafeez as he comes down the pitch and lofts this straight down the ground...nothing cross-batted about that
short and spinning away sharply outside off, it's a stretch to reach it in the end and he slices to deep cover
much fuller, driven to long off
another fantastic strike down the ground, this time from Malik, who used his feet and hammered it straight of long on
a straighter delivery outside off, worked into the leg side, Rashid chases it himself...they decide to stick at one
poor delivery, full down the leg side, very strongly swept away wide of short fine leg...Pakistan getting back on track
pull-driven to long on
he uses the pace to his advantage with a very smartly played whip/flick behind square on the leg side as Plunkett starts on the short side
gone now! Plunkett goes fuller, Hafeez aims to work it into the leg side, it was on the pads, but he gets a leading edge which loops gently to mid-off. The change has worked
swings wildly at a short-of-a-length delivery outside edge and a thick outside edge flies towards third man
tight to off stump, a nicely played dabbed to third man
well bowled, gets a yorker on target, a slower-ball too, Maqsood gets the bottom of the bat on it
slogs across the line of a full delivery outside off and finds deep square
nicely bowled, that might have been a googly, or a slider, it was outside and cramped him for room as he tried to cut
touch shorter, pulled to short fine leg
lovely from Rashid! Super bowling. He gave this a lot more air, very full, it was another googly and Maqsood plays all over the top of it...not a very clever innings
full outside off, driven in the air out to deep cover
worked through the leg side, placed between deep midwicket and long on...guess what? Yep, nearly another run out as they can't decide on the second
cut to cover to end a very fine spell from Rashid
that's good when the asking rate is 11, Parry drops it short and Malik pulls it powerfully off the back foot over deep square leg
wider outside off this time, picks out point as he cuts
gets this one wide of point to deep cover and this time they turn it into a second...a rare good piece of running
full at the pads, tries to work into the leg side but gets a leading edge
full outside off, driven to deep cover
gets forward and works this through midwicket and there's another swift piece of running...much better from Pakistan
tight on off stump, 87mph, runs it down to third man
short and wide but he can only cut to point

what a catch! Brilliant from Buttler down the leg side, but did it come off the pad? Akmal isn't happy at all. Regardless, though, the take was outstanding as Buttler dive full-length to his left to take it one-handed. First replay seems to show it was just pad. No reviews in the T20s.
driven firmly to cover
lofts a length delivery down the ground to long on
flicked down the ground
goes across the crease to a low full toss and clips it sweetly to deep midwicket
gives himself a touch of room the leg side and cracks this through the off side, wide enough of the sweeper for a second
across the crease and trying to sweep a very full delivery, just squirts a single
clubbed powerfully down the ground and there's some brilliant work on the boundary by Billings - no keeping gloves for him today - as he runs around from long off
a low, wide full toss but it comes off the bottom of the bat into the off side
very good yorker, Sarfraz does well to make two runs out of it as he forces it down the ground towards long on
full and straight, 87mph, jabbed out to the off side
another good full delivery which actually goes between Sarfraz's legs as he tries to flick it through the leg side...was an off-cutter, too
shorter and pulled without much timing, plops short of deep square...singles (and twos) no issue for England
finds deep midwicket! England closing in on the series. A shorter delivery, Malik went for the pull, it came from high off the bat - near the splice - and it's a simple catch for Billings
he's away first ball! A crunching blow wide of long on, a fuller delivery, couldn't quite get the leverage for the full amount
moving to the leg side, Plunkett follows him and fires it down the leg side, an extra ball and run
much better delivery, pinpoint yorker, Afridi swings and gets the bottom of the bat to the off side but it means he keeps the strike
what power! Full outside off and Afridi carves it over wide long-off with a fiercely powerful swing through the line
straighter this time, heaved through the leg side, Afridi wanted a second to long on but Sarfraz sent him back
full and wide, steered square through the off side to deep cover...more confusion over the second. Afridi wants to stay on strike
magnificent! Afridi is turning it on...goes across the crease and flicks a low full toss off the stumps over deep backward square leg. What scenes
that's a huge full toss outside off, Afridi carves it over the off side and clears deep cover...and it's a no-ball!
swing and a miss at the freebie! It was length outside off. Deep breath, everyone
called wide! Full outside off...Afridi will get another ball
and now he's got him! What an over. Full outside off, another mighty swing from Afridi, slices off the thick outside edge and is held at short third man
down the pitch and pings this straight but mid-off is able to get around
goes across the crease at a full toss and swings it behind square on the leg side...Pakistan still have a terrific chance
oh boy! Massive bonus for Pakistan. Willey got a good yorker in, was squeezed through the leg side, the throw came in and struck the diving batsman the rebounded away to the boundary. What. A. Moment
driven very sweetly through the off side
another low full toss, driven down the ground to long off...sensible cricket
full and straight, crunched down to long off so he'll have strike for the final over
first strike to Woakes! Sarfraz trying his favourite sweep, it was full outside off, he's right across the crease and basically hits it straight into his stumps.
on the pads, poor delivery, it's one-handed swing over square leg and it dribbles into the rope
full outside off, driven to mid-off who is on the edge of the circle
full outside off, well bowled, Anwar can only drill it down the ground to long off
on leg stump, he swings hard but he picks out long leg! Oh, boy, it was there to hit...picked out Plunkett on the boundary
swing and a miss! England hold on for the series. It was actually a length ball outside off, Anwar had a mighty heave but couldn't make contact.
